intro: Arachnorchis magniclavata, commonly known as the large-lobed spider-orchid, is an Australian orchid species characterized by its distinctive, spider-like floral structure. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is native to the eastern regions of Australia, particularly Queensland and New South Wales. The plant features long, slender leaves and produces large, showy flowers with a unique, intricate pattern of petals and sepals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforests or along streamlines. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
